title: If there was no known access to the internet, how would one be able to connect to it? - Quora

response.answer_text: You wouldn't be able too. A fundamental design goalbehind tcp/ip was that in a nuclear war it would be able to self route around destroyed network paths. That capability didn't extend to no network path though.  Unless you are specifically talking about ISp provided access. There are several private routes around that.

By tethering with your cell phone. This is assuming that it is only the local access wires that are cut.  of course, if every connection everywhere were cut, then there would be no access, because there would be no internet. :)
